body: That would help with a lot of PR comments about style.
Cool @phated. Thanks for the reply. I'll put one together.

@phated I'm looking around and don't see a styleguide for the Gulp codebase. Any reference with specific rules as to how you like the code written? Otherwise, I'll just whip up a JSCS config with rules that conform to the current style of the code.
@mrjoelkemp It's mostly just @contra's preferences.  If you submit something that passes with the current code base, we can work from there.
The styleguide for all of the projects is felixge's node-style-guide https://github.com/felixge/node-style-guide not just my preferences :palm_tree:

We should incorporate the jshintrc and eslintrc from that repo ^

This is a pretty big job considering how many repos we have now

issue.title: Bring JSCS to Gulp
issue.body:
Relevant discussion: https://github.com/gulpjs/gulp/issues/904

Any community members interested in tackling this?

body: @mrjoelkemp since the jscs PR was merged, would you be able to submit a PR for this now?

Hey @phated. I will put a PR together. Without a new release of jscs, I can't use the `node-style-guide` preset directly. However, I could just copy the guts of it into gulp's jscsrc and then do a follow up PR (once the new version of jscs hits) converting the big jscsrc into:

``` js
{
  "preset": "node-style-guide"
}
```

I'll put that together.

Is there a reason not to consider ESLint instead? There are also a number of nice features it provides but the major ones are:
- It is succinct extendable and based off of [ESTree](https://github.com/estree/estree)
- I can fill the role of JSHint + JSCS
- Allows you to warn OR fail error out for a less frustrating dev experience
- It is tracking ES6 and hopefully will support the full spec shortly

I'm happy to put together a PR if you'd be interested in that option

I'll avoid the general argument of JSCS vs ESLint. In this case, gulp's source isn't in es6 (though JSCS also has support for that). Plus, JSCS is a better fit for the task of thoroughly enforcing a styleguide.
